This setting applies to the Proximity feature. Set the maximum volume of the ultrasound pairing messages. The Audio Ultrasound MaxVolume and Proximity Mode settings only affect ultrasound pairing messages. See the RoomAnalytics PeoplePresenceDetector and Standby WakeupOnMotionDetection settings for information about the use of ultrasound in presence and motion detection.

This setting applies to the Proximity feature. Set the maximum volume of the ultrasound pairing messages. The Audio Ultrasound MaxVolume and Proximity Mode settings only affect ultrasound pairing messages. See the RoomAnalytics PeoplePresenceDetector and Standby WakeupOnMotionDetection settings for information about the use of ultrasound in presence and motion detection.
Enable or disable the audio channels on the USB connector.

description.AdditionalSpeaker: Both the video device's built-in loudspeakers and the USB audio output device will be used. The USB audio input channel is disabled.
description.Microphone: Only the external USB microphone will be used; other microphones are disabled. The USB audio output channel is also disabled.
description.Off: No audio will flow over USB but signaling is still enabled. This allows for using a USB device as a mute or volume controller.
description.Speaker: The USB audio output channel will be connected (speaker). Other speakers are disabled. The USB audio input channel is also disabled.
description.SpeakerAndMicrophone: Both the input (microphone) and output (speaker) channels of a USB audio device will be connected. Other microphones and speakers are disabled.

attributes.description: Enable or disable the audio channels on the USB connector.

description.AdditionalMicrophone: Both the video device's built-in microphone and an external audio input device (USB microphone) will be used. The USB audio output channel is disabled.
description.AdditionalSpeaker: Both the video device's built-in loudspeakers and the USB audio output device will be used. The USB audio input channel is disabled.
description.Microphone: Only the external USB microphone will be used; other microphones are disabled. The USB audio output channel is also disabled.
description.Off: No audio will flow over USB but signaling is still enabled. This allows for using a USB device as a mute or volume controller.
description.Speaker: The USB audio output channel will be connected (speaker). Other speakers are disabled. The USB audio input channel is also disabled.
description.SpeakerAndMicrophone: Both the input (microphone) and output (speaker) channels of a USB audio device will be connected. Other microphones and speakers are disabled.

attributes.description: This setting applies when a USB capture device (e.g. a USB microphone) is connected to the video device. If the USB device has an internal trim setting, you can request the USB device to trim the audio signal level before sending it to the video device. Use the Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Value setting to set how much gain/attenuation to apply.

description.Active: Allow the video device to request the USB device to trim its output level before sending the audio signal.
description.Bypass: Don't adjust the volume output from the USB device before sending it to the video device.

attributes.description: This setting applies if the Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Mode is set to Active. This is the gain that the video device requests the USB capture device to apply before sending the audio signal to the video device. The actual range that the USB device offers can be found in the Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Max and Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Min statuses. If the requested volume value is outside this range, the closest allowed value will be used. The Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Value status always returns the actual gain applied. Note that the USB device may apply a gain as default. Since the Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Value status always returns the actual gain applied, you may want to check this status before you decide on which gain to request. Example: If you want to request a 6 dB increase to the current level, and the default gain already applied by the USB device is 42 dB, you must set the Audio USB VolumeControl Capture Value setting to 48, that is 42+6 dB.

This setting applies when a USB playback device (e.g. a USB loudspeaker) is connected to the video device. If the USB device has an internal trim setting, you can request the USB device to trim the audio signal level it receives from the video device before any further processing. Use the Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Value setting to set how much gain/attenuation to apply.

description.Active: Allow the video device to request the USB device to trim the input level before further processing.
description.Bypass: Don't adjust the volume input to the USB device before further processing.

attributes.description: This setting applies if the Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Mode is set to Active. This is the gain that the video device requests the USB capture device to apply after receiving the audio signal from the video device. The actual range that the USB device offers can be found in the Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Max and Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Min statuses. If the requested volume value is outside this range, the closest allowed value will be used. The Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Value status always returns the actual gain applied. Note that the USB device may apply a gain as default. Since the Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Value status always returns the actual gain applied, you may want to check this status before you decide on which gain to request. Example: If you want to request a 6 dB increase to the current level, and the default gain already applied by the USB device is 42 dB, you must set the Audio USB VolumeControl Playback Value setting to 48, that is 42+6 dB.

The device has a built-in BluetoothÂ® module. As a default, the user can turn it on or off using the user interface. With this setting, the administrator can disable Bluetooth configuration, so that it cannot be set up from the user interface.

description.False: Bluetooth is switched off by the administrator, and the user cannot turn it on from the user interface.
description.True: Bluetooth is allowed. The user can turn it on or off from the user interface.

attributes.description: Provided that BluetoothÂ® connections are allowed (see the Bluetooth Allowed setting), you can use this setting to enable and disable Bluetooth. The video device supports the HFP (Hands-Free Profile) and A2DP (Advanced Audio Distribution Profile) profiles. Headsets that only supports A2DP cannot be used.

description.False: Bluetooth is disabled, and no Bluetooth devices can pair with the video device.
description.True: Bluetooth is enabled, and you can pair and use a Bluetooth headset.

attributes.description: Book Ahead allows users to schedule shared spaces for future times. With Book Ahead enabled, users can book rooms for times later in the day, even if the space is currently booked, through a controller, board, or scheduler.

description.False: Book ahead is not available.
description.True: Book ahead is available.

attributes.description: For ad hoc bookings, we need to wait a certain time to make sure it has been confirmed from the backend. This setting is useful for hybrid calendar situations where it might take a long time to get such confirmation of the booking. The booking shows up when you book ad hoc, but it might get removed if the backend (exchange, google calendar, etc.) does not confirm it in time. This setting determines how long we wait before removing it.

The ad hoc booking feature allows you to book a room directly from the navigator that is in or by the meeting room. You can also extend an ongoing meeting if the room is still available. You can also use the Webex Assistant (voice-driven virtual assistant) to book or extend a meeting. Ad-hoc booking is provided by the on-device calendar or the selected calendar provider in Control Hub.

description.False: The ad hoc booking feature is not available.
description.True: The ad hoc booking feature is available

attributes.description: Configures if you can decline a meeting and where you can decline it from; either using the dropdown in calendar list to remove it, or from the checkout button. Example: From controller inside the room, or from the scheduler on the wall outside the room, or no ability.

description.All: You can decline a meeting from navigators both inside and outside the room.
description.InsideOnly: You can decline a meeting from navigators inside the room.
description.None: You cannot decline a meeting from a navigator (neither controllers nor schedulers).

attributes.description: This setting is applicable only when the check-in option is enabled (refer to the Bookings Check-in Enabled setting). When enabled, bookings with extended durations, such as full-day bookings, are more likely to be automatically checked out and removed if users do not arrive in time to check in. Use this setting to specify the duration threshold for a booking to be automatically checked in, preventing it from being removed by the check-in setting.

In a significant percentage of meetings no one shows up and the meeting resources are wasted during the booking. Enabling the check in option helps alleviate this problem. The users can check in to their booking when they arrive to the meeting room which confirms the booking. If no one arrives for the booking, the meeting room can be released, and others can book the free meeting room. The check in option is available on shared bookable devices and standalone Room Navigator.

description.False: The check in option is not available.
description.True: The check in option is available.

attributes.description: This setting is relevant only if the check in option is enabled (see the Bookings Checkin Enabled setting). A check in button appears on the touch panels some minutes before a booking starts. Use this setting to define for how long after the booking start the user can check in.  If no one checks in during this period, manually or automatically, the room is automatically released, and the organizer gets an email informing about the cancellation. The room device will automatically check in for: ad hoc bookings, when joining a call, when a sharing session has started (wired or wireless), or people count is 1 or more.

This configuration allows you to control the type of meetings that can be declined on the device. Options include restricting declines to all meetings or only ad-hoc meetings. This is used with the AllowDecline configuration. This setting does not affect the CheckIn feature.

description.All: All types of meetings can be declined.

attributes.description: You can set the maximum duration allowed for ad hoc room booking and hot desking. For example, if set to 2 (hours), the time selector will only give you the next two hours for a max duration of your booking.

Video devices can join Microsoft Teams meetings either using SIP via a Cloud Video Interop (CVI) gateway, which is a service that is provided in the Webex cloud, or by running the Microsoft Teams meeting web app (WebRTC). Joining Microsoft Teams meetings relies on a calendar service and is available for devices that are registered to an on-premises service and linked to Webex Edge for Devices, and for devices that are registered to the Webex cloud service.

description.Auto: The device will join the Microsoft Teams meeting via SIP/CVI if there is a CVI address in the meeting invite. Otherwise it will use WebRTC.
description.WebRTC: The device will always use WebRTC for Microsoft Teams meetings.

attributes.description: If you use an external mouse or keyboard for your laptop (wired USB or USB dongle), you can connect them to the video device's USB port instead of directly to the laptop. To enable HID forwarding, ensure the configuration parameter Peripherals InputDevice Mode is set to Off.

description.False: You must connect the external mouse or keyboard directly to your laptop.
description.True: You can connect the external mouse or keyboard for your laptop to the video device.

attributes.description: Controls if users can use a QR code to pair their mobile phone and the video device through the Webex app. When enabled, the user just scans the QR code that is displayed on the device's screen and waits for the pairing process to complete. This setting applies only to devices that are set up for Hot desking, which implies that they must be in shared mode and registered to the Webex cloud service or linked to Webex Edge for Devices.

description.Disabled: There is no QR code on the device. Users must sign in another way (USB-C).
description.Enabled: There is a QR code on the device's screen, and users can scan it to sign in on the device.

attributes.description: Use this setting to enable or disable the touch redirect feature. Touch redirect enables you to control your laptop from the touch screen of the board or video device. You must connect the laptop to the device with an HDMI cable (wired sharing) and a USB-C cable. You can use either a USB-C to USB-C cable or a USB-C to USB-A cable from the device to the laptop. This feature is not available on the first generation of boards (Board 55 and 70).

description.False: Touch redirect is disabled.
description.True: Touch redirect is enabled.

attributes.description: This setting determines whether a laptop should automatically pair to the video device when it is connected with a USB-C cable.

description.Disabled: The devices will not automatically pair.
description.Enabled: The devices will pair once connected with a USB-C cable.

attributes.description: Specify whether or not information about calls that are placed or received are stored, including missed calls and calls that are not answered (call history). This determines whether or not the calls appear in the Recents list on the user interfaces.

description.Off: New entries are not added to the call history.
description.On: New entries are stored in the call history list.

attributes.description: You can choose to hide meeting titles from the Recents list. This list is available when tapping the Call button on the UI, and in the Call page on the device web interface. This setting is neither supported on shared mode devices where hotdesking is enabled nor on personal mode devices.

description.Auto: Keep meeting titles in the Recents list.
description.Hidden: Don't show meeting titles in the Recents list.

attributes.description: Enable or disable the Camera Background feature. The Camera Background feature allows for a virtual background (images or effects) to be shown as the background in the camera view, instead of the real surroundings. This configuration must be enabled to allow the Cameras Background Set command to take effect.

description.False: Disable the Camera Background feature.
description.True: Enable the Camera Background feature.

attributes.description: Enable or disable the ability for users to use custom images as virtual background during meetings or calls. The Cameras Background Enabled setting must also be enabled for this feature to be accessible.

description.False: Disable the use of custom images as virtual backgrounds.
description.True: Enable the use of custom images as virtual backgrounds.

attributes.description: The camera ID is the number n in Camera [n]. By default, the camera ID is assigned automatically to a camera. If EDID information is not passed on from the camera to the video device, the camera ID is not persistent after a reboot. This means that a camera may get a new camera ID when the video device is restarted. You should use the Cameras Camera AssignedSerialNumber setting to cater for configurations where the video device does not receive EDID information from multiple cameras. This setting allows you to manually assign a camera ID to a camera by associating the camera ID with the camera's serial number. The setting is persistent until the video device is factory reset. A typical situation where the video device doesn't receive EDID information is when using an HDMI repeater that doesn't pass on such information.

Turn backlight compensation on or off. Backlight compensation is useful when there is much light behind the persons in the room. Without compensation the persons may appear very dark to the far end. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2. If the Cameras Camera Brightness Algorithm is not set to Average, neither is it applicable to the Quad camera and the integrated camera of Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Off: Turn off the camera backlight compensation.
description.On: Turn on the camera backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Specify the camera brightness algorithm.

description.Auto: The camera brightness algorithm is automatically set by the device.
description.Average: The traditional brightness algorithm is applied. This uses the entire image area to calculate brightness.
description.FaceOptimized: Brightness is calculated by weighing the areas where people are detected. This includes automatic backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: With Flip mode (vertical flip), you can flip the image upside down. Flipping applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. This setting is not supported by the Quad Camera, the PTZ-12 camera, or the integrated camera of Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically flipped. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed. As an example, the Sony PTZ 4K camera cannot auto-detect that it's upside down. If you mount it upside down, you must set this parameter to On.
description.Off: Display the image on screen the normal way.
description.On: Display the image flipped upside down. This setting is used when a camera is mounted upside down, but cannot automatically detect which way it is mounted.

attributes.description: Define the camera focus mode.

description.Auto: A Precision 60 or PTZ 4K camera will do continuous auto focusing. It will run auto focus once a call is connected, after pan, tilt, zoom have changed, and generally when the camera identifies a change in the scene. The integrated camera will do single shot auto focusing once a call is connected and when the view has changed.
description.Manual: Turn the autofocus off and adjust the camera focus manually.

attributes.description: By setting the Gamma Level you can select which gamma correction table to use. This setting may be useful in difficult lighting conditions, where changes to the brightness setting does not provide satisfactory results. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

This setting enables gamma corrections. Gamma describes the nonlinear relationship between image pixels and monitor brightness. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

description.Auto: Auto is the default and the recommended setting.
description.Manual: In manual mode the gamma value is changed with the gamma level setting, ref. Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Level.

attributes.description: This setting applies only to the PTZ 4K camera and will not have any effect on other cameras. The IR cut filter (infrared cut-off filter) blocks near-infrared wavelengths while passing visible light. In regular lighting conditions, the filter should be on (Day mode) to avoid unwanted side-effects caused by infrared light. However, if you want the camera to capture images in the dark, the filter should be off (Night mode) so that infrared light can be utilized.

description.Auto: The devices switches between Day and Night mode automatically based on changes in brightness. Refer to the IrCutFilter Threshold setting how to control when to switch between the two modes.
description.Day: The IR cut filter is on.
description.Night: The IR cut filter is off.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

With Mirror mode (horizontal flip) you can mirror the image on screen. Mirroring applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. Mirroring is automatically disabled when speaker tracking is on. This setting is only applicable when using a Precision 60 camera. However, the PTZ 4K camera automatically mirrors the image when the Cameras Camera [n] Flip setting is On.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

attributes.description: Configures the standby mode for the specified camera [n].

description.Disabled: When the device enters standby mode, no power-off command is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, the camera remains in its previous state without any additional movement, making it immediately available for use.
description.Enabled: When the device enters standby mode, power-off is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, power-on is issued, causing the camera to perform a calibration process. During calibration, the camera pans to its maximum position and then returns to the center, which takes approximately 12 seconds.

attributes.description: Sets the camera's output video resolution and framerate.

description.1920_1080_30: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 30 frames per second.
description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

attributes.description: Define the white balance level. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Whitebalance Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this setting has no effect for the PTZ-12 camera, which is using Sony's One Push mode when the Whitebalance Mode is set to manual.

Define the camera white balance mode. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Auto: The camera will continuously adjust the white balance depending on the camera view.
description.Manual: Enables manual control of the camera white balance. The white balance level is set using the Cameras Camera Whitebalance Level setting.

attributes.description: The camera ID is the number n in Camera [n]. By default, the camera ID is assigned automatically to a camera. If EDID information is not passed on from the camera to the video device, the camera ID is not persistent after a reboot. This means that a camera may get a new camera ID when the video device is restarted. You should use the Cameras Camera AssignedSerialNumber setting to cater for configurations where the video device does not receive EDID information from multiple cameras. This setting allows you to manually assign a camera ID to a camera by associating the camera ID with the camera's serial number. The setting is persistent until the video device is factory reset. A typical situation where the video device doesn't receive EDID information is when using an HDMI repeater that doesn't pass on such information.

description.Off: Turn off the camera backlight compensation.
description.On: Turn on the camera backlight compensation.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: When set, this configuration instructs the Multi Camera Director to ignore faces that appear in selected areas of a camera's field of view. The format is a list of polygons separated by semicolons. Each polygon is defined by 3 or more coordinate pairs, separated by commas. The coordinates are spherical and expressed in hundredths of degrees. For example, "0,0" would indicate a ray pointing straight out of the camera. "100,100" would indicate a ray pointing one degree to the left and one degree up from the camera. For a motorized camera, the coordinate system is relative to the neutral position of the camera, and does not change when the camera moves. For multi camera setups it is useful to note that the exclusion zones are defined per camera. Example: "1000,500, 500,500, 500,-500, 1000,500; -2000,-1000, -2500,-1000, -2500,-1500, -2000,-1500" This defines two exclusion zones: - The first is from (10Â°,5Â°) to (5Â°,-5Â°). - The second is from (-20Â°,-10Â°) to (-25Â°,-15Â°)

With Flip mode (vertical flip), you can flip the image upside down. Flipping applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. This setting is not supported by the Quad Camera, the PTZ-12 camera, or the integrated camera of Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically flipped. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed. As an example, the Sony PTZ 4K camera cannot auto-detect that it's upside down. If you mount it upside down, you must set this parameter to On.
description.Off: Display the image on screen the normal way.
description.On: Display the image flipped upside down. This setting is used when a camera is mounted upside down, but cannot automatically detect which way it is mounted.

attributes.description: Define the camera focus mode.

description.Auto: A Quad Camera will do single shot auto focusing once a call is connected and when the view has changed. A Precision 60 or PTZ 4K camera will do continuous auto focusing. It will run auto focus once a call is connected, after pan, tilt, zoom have changed, and generally when the camera identifies a change in the scene.
description.AutoLimited: Precision 60 camera. In most cases, this mode will operate the same way as Auto. In some cases, AutoLimited will reduce the focus hunting that may occur.
description.Manual: Turn the autofocus off and adjust the camera focus manually.

description.Auto: Auto is the default and the recommended setting.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

attributes.description: Enables the PTZ AutoFraming feature of the Sony SRG-A40 and  SRG-A12.

description.Off: Disables the AutoFraming feature.
description.On: Enables the AutoFraming feature.

attributes.description: Configures the standby mode for the specified camera [n].

description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

Define the camera white balance mode. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Auto: The camera will continuously adjust the white balance depending on the camera view.
description.Manual: Enables manual control of the camera white balance. The white balance level is set using the Cameras Camera Whitebalance Level setting.

You should use the Cameras Camera AssignedSerialNumber setting to cater for configurations where the video device does not receive EDID information from multiple cameras. This setting allows you to manually assign a camera ID to a camera by associating the camera ID with the camera's serial number. The setting is persistent until the video device is factory reset. A typical situation where the video device doesn't receive EDID information is when using an HDMI repeater that doesn't pass on such information.

Turn backlight compensation on or off. Backlight compensation is useful when there is much light behind the persons in the room. Without compensation the persons may appear very dark to the far end. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2. If the Cameras Camera Brightness Algorithm is not set to Average, neither is it applicable to the Quad camera and the integrated camera of Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Off: Turn off the camera backlight compensation.
description.On: Turn on the camera backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Specify the camera brightness algorithm.

description.Auto: The camera brightness algorithm is automatically set by the device.
description.Average: The traditional brightness algorithm is applied. This uses the entire image area to calculate brightness.
description.FaceOptimized: Brightness is calculated by weighing the areas where people are detected. This includes automatic backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: With Flip mode (vertical flip), you can flip the image upside down. Flipping applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. This setting is not supported by the Quad Camera, the PTZ-12 camera, or the integrated camera of Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically flipped. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed. As an example, the Sony PTZ 4K camera cannot auto-detect that it's upside down. If you mount it upside down, you must set this parameter to On.
description.Off: Display the image on screen the normal way.
description.On: Display the image flipped upside down. This setting is used when a camera is mounted upside down, but cannot automatically detect which way it is mounted.

attributes.description: Define the camera focus mode.

description.Auto: A Precision 60 or PTZ 4K camera will do continuous auto focusing. It will run auto focus once a call is connected, after pan, tilt, zoom have changed, and generally when the camera identifies a change in the scene. The integrated camera will do single shot auto focusing once a call is connected and when the view has changed.
description.Manual: Turn the autofocus off and adjust the camera focus manually.

attributes.description: By setting the Gamma Level you can select which gamma correction table to use. This setting may be useful in difficult lighting conditions, where changes to the brightness setting does not provide satisfactory results. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

This setting enables gamma corrections. Gamma describes the nonlinear relationship between image pixels and monitor brightness. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

description.Auto: Auto is the default and the recommended setting.
description.Manual: In manual mode the gamma value is changed with the gamma level setting, ref. Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Level.

attributes.description: This setting applies only to the PTZ 4K camera and will not have any effect on other cameras. The IR cut filter (infrared cut-off filter) blocks near-infrared wavelengths while passing visible light. In regular lighting conditions, the filter should be on (Day mode) to avoid unwanted side-effects caused by infrared light. However, if you want the camera to capture images in the dark, the filter should be off (Night mode) so that infrared light can be utilized.

description.Auto: The devices switches between Day and Night mode automatically based on changes in brightness. Refer to the IrCutFilter Threshold setting how to control when to switch between the two modes.
description.Day: The IR cut filter is on.
description.Night: The IR cut filter is off.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

With Mirror mode (horizontal flip) you can mirror the image on screen. Mirroring applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. Mirroring is automatically disabled when speaker tracking is on. This setting is only applicable when using a Precision 60 camera. However, the PTZ 4K camera automatically mirrors the image when the Cameras Camera [n] Flip setting is On.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

attributes.description: Configures the standby mode for the specified camera [n].

description.Disabled: When the device enters standby mode, no power-off command is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, the camera remains in its previous state without any additional movement, making it immediately available for use.
description.Enabled: When the device enters standby mode, power-off is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, power-on is issued, causing the camera to perform a calibration process. During calibration, the camera pans to its maximum position and then returns to the center, which takes approximately 12 seconds.

attributes.description: Sets the camera's output video resolution and framerate.

description.1920_1080_30: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 30 frames per second.
description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

attributes.description: Define the white balance level. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Whitebalance Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this setting has no effect for the PTZ-12 camera, which is using Sony's One Push mode when the Whitebalance Mode is set to manual.

attributes.description: The camera ID is the number n in Camera [n]. By default, the camera ID is assigned automatically to a camera. If EDID information is not passed on from the camera to the video device, the camera ID is not persistent after a reboot. This means that a camera may get a new camera ID when the video device is restarted. You should use the Cameras Camera AssignedSerialNumber setting to cater for configurations where the video device does not receive EDID information from multiple cameras. This setting allows you to manually assign a camera ID to a camera by associating the camera ID with the camera's serial number. The setting is persistent until the video device is factory reset. A typical situation where the video device doesn't receive EDID information is when using an HDMI repeater that doesn't pass on such information.

Turn backlight compensation on or off. Backlight compensation is useful when there is much light behind the persons in the room. Without compensation the persons may appear very dark to the far end. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2. If the Cameras Camera Brightness Algorithm is not set to Average, neither is it applicable to the Quad camera and the integrated camera of Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Off: Turn off the camera backlight compensation.
description.On: Turn on the camera backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Specify the camera brightness algorithm.

description.Auto: The camera brightness algorithm is automatically set by the device.
description.Average: The traditional brightness algorithm is applied. This uses the entire image area to calculate brightness.
description.FaceOptimized: Brightness is calculated by weighing the areas where people are detected. This includes automatic backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: With Flip mode (vertical flip), you can flip the image upside down. Flipping applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. This setting is not supported by the Quad Camera, the PTZ-12 camera, or the integrated camera of Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically flipped. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed. As an example, the Sony PTZ 4K camera cannot auto-detect that it's upside down. If you mount it upside down, you must set this parameter to On.
description.Off: Display the image on screen the normal way.
description.On: Display the image flipped upside down. This setting is used when a camera is mounted upside down, but cannot automatically detect which way it is mounted.

attributes.description: Define the camera focus mode.

description.Auto: A Precision 60 or PTZ 4K camera will do continuous auto focusing. It will run auto focus once a call is connected, after pan, tilt, zoom have changed, and generally when the camera identifies a change in the scene. The integrated camera will do single shot auto focusing once a call is connected and when the view has changed.
description.Manual: Turn the autofocus off and adjust the camera focus manually.

attributes.description: By setting the Gamma Level you can select which gamma correction table to use. This setting may be useful in difficult lighting conditions, where changes to the brightness setting does not provide satisfactory results. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

This setting enables gamma corrections. Gamma describes the nonlinear relationship between image pixels and monitor brightness. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

description.Auto: Auto is the default and the recommended setting.
description.Manual: In manual mode the gamma value is changed with the gamma level setting, ref. Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Level.

attributes.description: This setting applies only to the PTZ 4K camera and will not have any effect on other cameras. The IR cut filter (infrared cut-off filter) blocks near-infrared wavelengths while passing visible light. In regular lighting conditions, the filter should be on (Day mode) to avoid unwanted side-effects caused by infrared light. However, if you want the camera to capture images in the dark, the filter should be off (Night mode) so that infrared light can be utilized.

description.Auto: The devices switches between Day and Night mode automatically based on changes in brightness. Refer to the IrCutFilter Threshold setting how to control when to switch between the two modes.
description.Day: The IR cut filter is on.
description.Night: The IR cut filter is off.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

With Mirror mode (horizontal flip) you can mirror the image on screen. Mirroring applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. Mirroring is automatically disabled when speaker tracking is on. This setting is only applicable when using a Precision 60 camera. However, the PTZ 4K camera automatically mirrors the image when the Cameras Camera [n] Flip setting is On.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

attributes.description: Configures the standby mode for the specified camera [n].

description.Disabled: When the device enters standby mode, no power-off command is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, the camera remains in its previous state without any additional movement, making it immediately available for use.
description.Enabled: When the device enters standby mode, power-off is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, power-on is issued, causing the camera to perform a calibration process. During calibration, the camera pans to its maximum position and then returns to the center, which takes approximately 12 seconds.

attributes.description: Sets the camera's output video resolution and framerate.

description.1920_1080_30: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 30 frames per second.
description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

attributes.description: Define the white balance level. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Whitebalance Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this setting has no effect for the PTZ-12 camera, which is using Sony's One Push mode when the Whitebalance Mode is set to manual.

Define the camera white balance mode. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Auto: The camera will continuously adjust the white balance depending on the camera view.
description.Manual: Enables manual control of the camera white balance. The white balance level is set using the Cameras Camera Whitebalance Level setting.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: When set, this configuration instructs the Multi Camera Director to ignore faces that appear in selected areas of a camera's field of view. The format is a list of polygons separated by semicolons. Each polygon is defined by 3 or more coordinate pairs, separated by commas. The coordinates are spherical and expressed in hundredths of degrees. For example, "0,0" would indicate a ray pointing straight out of the camera. "100,100" would indicate a ray pointing one degree to the left and one degree up from the camera. For a motorized camera, the coordinate system is relative to the neutral position of the camera, and does not change when the camera moves. For multi camera setups it is useful to note that the exclusion zones are defined per camera. Example: "1000,500, 500,500, 500,-500, 1000,500; -2000,-1000, -2500,-1000, -2500,-1500, -2000,-1500" This defines two exclusion zones: - The first is from (10Â°,5Â°) to (5Â°,-5Â°). - The second is from (-20Â°,-10Â°) to (-25Â°,-15Â°)

Sets the white balance compensation level of the specified camera. If you find the camera image always to be too cold (with blue-ish tint) or too warm (with yellow-ish tint), you can use this setting to offset the default auto white balance. The white balance will continue to be adjusted automatically. Negative values of this setting will make the image appear colder, while positive values will make it appear warmer. The device must be restarted after changing this setting for the change to take effect.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

With Mirror mode (horizontal flip) you can mirror the image on screen. Mirroring applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. Mirroring is automatically disabled when speaker tracking is on. This setting is only applicable when using a Precision 60 camera. However, the PTZ 4K camera automatically mirrors the image when the Cameras Camera [n] Flip setting is On.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

attributes.description: Configures the standby mode for the specified camera [n].

description.Disabled: When the device enters standby mode, no power-off command is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, the camera remains in its previous state without any additional movement, making it immediately available for use.
description.Enabled: When the device enters standby mode, power-off is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, power-on is issued, causing the camera to perform a calibration process. During calibration, the camera pans to its maximum position and then returns to the center, which takes approximately 12 seconds.

attributes.description: Sets the camera's output video resolution and framerate.

description.1920_1080_30: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 30 frames per second.
description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

attributes.description: Define the white balance level. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Whitebalance Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this setting has no effect for the PTZ-12 camera, which is using Sony's One Push mode when the Whitebalance Mode is set to manual.

Define the camera white balance mode. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Auto: The camera will continuously adjust the white balance depending on the camera view.
description.Manual: Enables manual control of the camera white balance. The white balance level is set using the Cameras Camera Whitebalance Level setting.

attributes.description: The camera ID is the number n in Camera [n]. By default, the camera ID is assigned automatically to a camera. If EDID information is not passed on from the camera to the video device, the camera ID is not persistent after a reboot. This means that a camera may get a new camera ID when the video device is restarted. You should use the Cameras Camera AssignedSerialNumber setting to cater for configurations where the video device does not receive EDID information from multiple cameras. This setting allows you to manually assign a camera ID to a camera by associating the camera ID with the camera's serial number. The setting is persistent until the video device is factory reset. A typical situation where the video device doesn't receive EDID information is when using an HDMI repeater that doesn't pass on such information.

Turn backlight compensation on or off. Backlight compensation is useful when there is much light behind the persons in the room. Without compensation the persons may appear very dark to the far end. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2. If the Cameras Camera Brightness Algorithm is not set to Average, neither is it applicable to the Quad camera and the integrated camera of Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Off: Turn off the camera backlight compensation.
description.On: Turn on the camera backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Specify the camera brightness algorithm.

description.Auto: The camera brightness algorithm is automatically set by the device.
description.Average: The traditional brightness algorithm is applied. This uses the entire image area to calculate brightness.
description.FaceOptimized: Brightness is calculated by weighing the areas where people are detected. This includes automatic backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: With Flip mode (vertical flip), you can flip the image upside down. Flipping applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. This setting is not supported by the Quad Camera, the PTZ-12 camera, or the integrated camera of Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically flipped. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed. As an example, the Sony PTZ 4K camera cannot auto-detect that it's upside down. If you mount it upside down, you must set this parameter to On.
description.Off: Display the image on screen the normal way.
description.On: Display the image flipped upside down. This setting is used when a camera is mounted upside down, but cannot automatically detect which way it is mounted.

attributes.description: Define the camera focus mode.

description.Auto: A Precision 60 or PTZ 4K camera will do continuous auto focusing. It will run auto focus once a call is connected, after pan, tilt, zoom have changed, and generally when the camera identifies a change in the scene. The integrated camera will do single shot auto focusing once a call is connected and when the view has changed.
description.Manual: Turn the autofocus off and adjust the camera focus manually.

attributes.description: By setting the Gamma Level you can select which gamma correction table to use. This setting may be useful in difficult lighting conditions, where changes to the brightness setting does not provide satisfactory results. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

This setting enables gamma corrections. Gamma describes the nonlinear relationship between image pixels and monitor brightness. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

description.Auto: Auto is the default and the recommended setting.
description.Manual: In manual mode the gamma value is changed with the gamma level setting, ref. Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Level.

attributes.description: This setting applies only to the PTZ 4K camera and will not have any effect on other cameras. The IR cut filter (infrared cut-off filter) blocks near-infrared wavelengths while passing visible light. In regular lighting conditions, the filter should be on (Day mode) to avoid unwanted side-effects caused by infrared light. However, if you want the camera to capture images in the dark, the filter should be off (Night mode) so that infrared light can be utilized.

description.Auto: The devices switches between Day and Night mode automatically based on changes in brightness. Refer to the IrCutFilter Threshold setting how to control when to switch between the two modes.
description.Day: The IR cut filter is on.
description.Night: The IR cut filter is off.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

However, if you want the camera to capture images in the dark, the filter should be off (Night mode) so that infrared light can be utilized.

description.Auto: The devices switches between Day and Night mode automatically based on changes in brightness. Refer to the IrCutFilter Threshold setting how to control when to switch between the two modes.
description.Day: The IR cut filter is on.
description.Night: The IR cut filter is off.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

With Mirror mode (horizontal flip) you can mirror the image on screen. Mirroring applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. Mirroring is automatically disabled when speaker tracking is on. This setting is only applicable when using a Precision 60 camera. However, the PTZ 4K camera automatically mirrors the image when the Cameras Camera [n] Flip setting is On.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

attributes.description: Configures the standby mode for the specified camera [n].

description.Disabled: When the device enters standby mode, no power-off command is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, the camera remains in its previous state without any additional movement, making it immediately available for use.
description.Enabled: When the device enters standby mode, power-off is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, power-on is issued, causing the camera to perform a calibration process. During calibration, the camera pans to its maximum position and then returns to the center, which takes approximately 12 seconds.

attributes.description: Sets the camera's output video resolution and framerate.

description.1920_1080_30: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 30 frames per second.
description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

attributes.description: Define the white balance level. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Whitebalance Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this setting has no effect for the PTZ-12 camera, which is using Sony's One Push mode when the Whitebalance Mode is set to manual.

Define the camera white balance mode. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Auto: The camera will continuously adjust the white balance depending on the camera view.
description.Manual: Enables manual control of the camera white balance. The white balance level is set using the Cameras Camera Whitebalance Level setting.

attributes.description: The camera ID is the number n in Camera [n]. By default, the camera ID is assigned automatically to a camera. If EDID information is not passed on from the camera to the video device, the camera ID is not persistent after a reboot. This means that a camera may get a new camera ID when the video device is restarted. You should use the Cameras Camera AssignedSerialNumber setting to cater for configurations where the video device does not receive EDID information from multiple cameras. This setting allows you to manually assign a camera ID to a camera by associating the camera ID with the camera's serial number. The setting is persistent until the video device is factory reset. A typical situation where the video device doesn't receive EDID information is when using an HDMI repeater that doesn't pass on such information.

Turn backlight compensation on or off. Backlight compensation is useful when there is much light behind the persons in the room. Without compensation the persons may appear very dark to the far end. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2. If the Cameras Camera Brightness Algorithm is not set to Average, neither is it applicable to the Quad camera and the integrated camera of Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Off: Turn off the camera backlight compensation.
description.On: Turn on the camera backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Specify the camera brightness algorithm.

description.Auto: The camera brightness algorithm is automatically set by the device.
description.Average: The traditional brightness algorithm is applied. This uses the entire image area to calculate brightness.
description.FaceOptimized: Brightness is calculated by weighing the areas where people are detected. This includes automatic backlight compensation.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: With Flip mode (vertical flip), you can flip the image upside down. Flipping applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. This setting is not supported by the Quad Camera, the PTZ-12 camera, or the integrated camera of Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, or Room Panorama.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically flipped. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed. As an example, the Sony PTZ 4K camera cannot auto-detect that it's upside down. If you mount it upside down, you must set this parameter to On.
description.Off: Display the image on screen the normal way.
description.On: Display the image flipped upside down. This setting is used when a camera is mounted upside down, but cannot automatically detect which way it is mounted.

attributes.description: Define the camera focus mode.

description.Auto: A Precision 60 or PTZ 4K camera will do continuous auto focusing. It will run auto focus once a call is connected, after pan, tilt, zoom have changed, and generally when the camera identifies a change in the scene. The integrated camera will do single shot auto focusing once a call is connected and when the view has changed.
description.Manual: Turn the autofocus off and adjust the camera focus manually.

attributes.description: By setting the Gamma Level you can select which gamma correction table to use. This setting may be useful in difficult lighting conditions, where changes to the brightness setting does not provide satisfactory results. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

This setting enables gamma corrections. Gamma describes the nonlinear relationship between image pixels and monitor brightness. This setting is not applicable for the Quad Camera or the integrated cameras of Bar Pro, Board Pro, Board Pro G2, Room 55 Dual, Room 70, Room 70 G2, Room 70 Panorama, and Room Panorama. These cameras automatically adjust themselves based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this feature is not supported by the PTZ 4K camera or the PTZ-12 camera.

description.Auto: Auto is the default and the recommended setting.
description.Manual: In manual mode the gamma value is changed with the gamma level setting, ref. Cameras Camera [n] Gamma Level.

attributes.description: This setting applies only to the PTZ 4K camera and will not have any effect on other cameras. The IR cut filter (infrared cut-off filter) blocks near-infrared wavelengths while passing visible light. In regular lighting conditions, the filter should be on (Day mode) to avoid unwanted side-effects caused by infrared light. However, if you want the camera to capture images in the dark, the filter should be off (Night mode) so that infrared light can be utilized.

description.Auto: The devices switches between Day and Night mode automatically based on changes in brightness. Refer to the IrCutFilter Threshold setting how to control when to switch between the two modes.
description.Day: The IR cut filter is on.
description.Night: The IR cut filter is off.

attributes.description: This setting has an effect only when Cameras Camera [n] IrCutFilter Mode is set to Auto, that is, when the camera is set to switch between Day and Night mode automatically. The higher the threshold value, the more light is required to trigger a switch to Day mode.

With Mirror mode (horizontal flip) you can mirror the image on screen. Mirroring applies both to the self-view and the video that is transmitted to the far end. Mirroring is automatically disabled when speaker tracking is on. This setting is only applicable when using a Precision 60 camera. However, the PTZ 4K camera automatically mirrors the image when the Cameras Camera [n] Flip setting is On.

description.Auto: If the camera detects that it is mounted upside down, the image is automatically mirrored. If the camera cannot auto-detect whether it is mounted upside down or not, the image is not changed.
description.Off: Display the image as other people see you.
description.On: Display the image as you see yourself in a mirror.

description.Disabled: When the device enters standby mode, no power-off command is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, the camera remains in its previous state without any additional movement, making it immediately available for use.
description.Enabled: When the device enters standby mode, power-off is sent to the camera. Upon exiting standby, power-on is issued, causing the camera to perform a calibration process. During calibration, the camera pans to its maximum position and then returns to the center, which takes approximately 12 seconds.

attributes.description: Sets the camera's output video resolution and framerate.

description.1920_1080_30: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 30 frames per second.
description.1920_1080_60: The camera output is 1920x1080 resolution at 60 frames per second.
description.3840_2160_30: The camera output is 3840x2160 resolution at 30 frames per second (supported only by the PTZ 4K camera).

attributes.description: Define the white balance level. Requires the Cameras Camera [n] Whitebalance Mode to be set to Manual. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions. Also, this setting has no effect for the PTZ-12 camera, which is using Sony's One Push mode when the Whitebalance Mode is set to manual.

Define the camera white balance mode. This setting is not applicable for the integrated camera of Bar Pro, Board Pro, and Board Pro G2, which automatically adjusts itself based on the room lighting conditions.

description.Auto: The camera will continuously adjust the white balance depending on the camera view.
description.Manual: Enables manual control of the camera white balance. The white balance level is set using the Cameras Camera Whitebalance Level setting.

attributes.description: Set the brightness level. Requires the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode to be Manual.

When the Brightness Mode is set to Auto the brightness is set and continuously adjusted by the device based on the current lighting conditions. There is no auto-adjustment in Manual mode, and the brightness level is manually set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

description.Auto: The camera brightness is automatically adjusted by the device. The Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting has no effect.
description.Manual: Enable manual control of the camera brightness level. The brightness level is set using the Cameras Camera Brightness DefaultLevel setting.

attributes.description: You can change the color saturation in the video sent from the camera. The higher the number the more saturated (intense) are the colors.

When set, this configuration instructs the Multi Camera Director to ignore faces that appear in selected areas of a camera's field of view. The format is a list of polygons separated by semicolons. Each polygon is defined by 3 or more coordinate pairs, separated by commas. The coordinates are spherical and expressed in hundredths of degrees. For example, "0,0" would indicate a ray pointing straight out of the camera. "100,100" would indicate a ray pointing one degree to the left and one degree up from the camera. For a motorized camera, the coordinate system is relative to the neutral position of the camera, and does not change when the camera moves. For multi camera setups it is useful to note that the exclusion zones are defined per camera. Example: "1000,500, 500,500, 500,-500, 1000,500; -2000,-1000, -2500,-1000, -2500,-1500, -2000,-1500" This defines two exclusion zones: - The first is from (10Â°,5Â°) to (5Â°,-5Â°). - The second is from (-20Â°,-10Â°) to (-25Â°,-15Â°)

If you find the camera image always to be too dark (under-exposed) or too bright (over-exposed), you can use this setting to offset the target brightness. The brightness/exposure will continue to be adjusted automatically. This setting has an effect only when the Cameras Camera Brightness Mode is set to Auto.

Sets the white balance compensation level of the specified camera. If you find the camera image always to be too cold (with blue-ish tint) or too warm (with yellow-ish tint), you can use this setting to offset the default auto white balance. The white balance will continue to be adjusted automatically. Negative values of this setting will make the image appear colder, while positive values will make it appear warmer. The device must be restarted after changing this setting for the change to take effect.

If your camera supports power line frequency anti-flickering, the camera is able to compensate for any flicker noise from the electrical power supply. You should set this camera configuration based on your power line frequency. If your camera supports auto detection of line frequency, you can select the Auto option in the configuration. The Cisco cameras support both anti-flickering and auto detection of line frequency. Auto is the default value, so you should change this setting if you have a camera that does not support auto detection.

description.50Hz: Use this value when the power line frequency is 50 Hz.
description.60Hz: Use this value when the power line frequency is 60 Hz.
description.Auto: Allow the camera to detect the power frequency automatically.

attributes.description: Define the pan position that the presenter tracking camera (PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera) will move to when the feature is activated.
Define the tilt position that the presenter tracking camera (PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera) will move to when the feature is activated.
Define the zoom position that the presenter tracking camera (PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera) will move to when the feature is activated.
Define which video input connector the presenter tracking camera (PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera) is connected to.
Define which video input connector the presenter tracking camera (PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera) is connected to.
Define which video input connector the presenter tracking camera (PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera) is connected to.
Define whether or not the PresenterTrack feature is available for use. The feature requires a PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera as presenter tracking camera.

description.False: The PresenterTrack feature is disabled.
description.True: The PresenterTrack feature is available for use.

attributes.description: Define whether to enable or disable automatic switching between the Remote Presenter and Local Presenter modes in the Briefing room and Classroom scenarios (Room Type templates). Automatic switching implies that the device switches to Local Presenter mode when a person is detected in the PresenterTrack trigger zone, and that the device switches back to the Remote Presenter mode when the local presenter leaves the stage. If this setting is enabled, the Cameras PresenterTrack PresenterDetected status will be updated when a new person enters the trigger zone. Only the Precision 60 and PTZ 4K cameras support presenter tracking. Briefing room is not supported by Codec Plus, Room 70, and Room 55 Dual. This setting is not applicable to Board Pro and Board Pro G2, since neither Briefing room nor Classroom is supported.

description.Disabled: No automatic switching between modes.
description.Enabled: Automatic switching between the Local Presenter and Remote Presenter modes.

attributes.description: Define the trigger zone, which corresponds to the area where a person's head must be detected for presenter tracking to start. The format is a string of x and y coordinate pairs: "x1,y1,...xn,yn", where the range of x is (0,1920) and y is (0,1080). Two coordinate pairs define the upper left and lower right corner of a rectangular trigger zone. More than two coordinate pairs define the vertices of a polygonal trigger zone. The feature requires a PTZ 4K or Precision 60 camera as presenter tracking camera.

Turn on/off the closeup and group framing feature. This setting applies only when the Cameras SpeakerTrack Mode is set to Auto. When the closeup functionality is turned on, the device will detect that a person is speaking and select the best framing to cover that person. This is called a closeup and may not include all the persons in the room. If you want all the persons in the room to be in the picture at all times you can turn off the closeup functionality.

description.Auto: The device will zoom in either solely on the active speaker or the active speaker and the participants in close proximity to him/her (group frame).
description.Off: The device will keep all the persons in the room in the camera framing at all times.
description.On: The device will zoom in on the active speaker or the group frame.

attributes.description: Define the number of the video input that SpeakerTrack 60's left camera is connected to. This setting applies only when a SpeakerTrack 60 camera is connected to the video device. Furthermore, Cameras SpeakerTrack ConnectorDetection Mode must be set to Manual. Codec EQ doesn't support the SpeakerTrack 60 camera.

Define the number of the video input that SpeakerTrack 60's right camera is connected to. This setting applies only when a SpeakerTrack 60 camera is connected to the video device. Furthermore, Cameras SpeakerTrack ConnectorDetection Mode must be set to Manual. Codec EQ doesn't support the SpeakerTrack 60 camera.

This setting applies only when a SpeakerTrack 60 camera is connected to the video device.
