attributes.description: This status reports whether or not the "Video Mute" button is visible on the user interface.

description.Hidden: The button is not shown on the user interface.
description.Visible: The button is visible on the user interface.

attributes.description: This status reports whether the Call from laptop button is visible on the touch controller.

description.Hidden: The button is not visible on the touch controller.
description.Visible: The button is visible on the touch controller.

attributes.description: This status reports whether the default Files button is removed from the user interface.

description.Hidden: The button is removed from the user interface.
description.Visible: The button is in the user interface.

attributes.description: This status reports whether or not the default buttons and other UI elements for sharing and previewing content, both in call and out of call, are removed from the user interface.

description.Hidden: The button is removed from the user interface.
description.Visible: The button is in the user interface.

attributes.description: This status reports whether or not the default Whiteboard button is removed from the user interface.

description.Hidden: The button is removed from the user interface.
description.Visible: The button is in the user interface.

attributes.description: The wall mount version of the Room Navigator has LED lights. This status returns the state of the LED lights.

description.Off: The LED lights are off.

attributes.description: Indicates which monitor on-screen information and indicators (OSD) are displayed on.
Reports whether a PIN lock is set for the device.

description.Disabled: PIN lock is not set up for the device, but the feature is available if the user chooses to set it up.
description.Locked: PIN lock is set up for the device, and the device is currently locked
description.Unavailable: The PIN lock feature is not allowed on this device.
description.Unlocked: PIN lock is set up for the device, but the device is currently unlocked.

attributes.description: This status reports whether or not the control panel, including the device settings panel, is part of the user interface.

description.Hidden: The control panel is not shown.
description.Visible: The control panel is included in the user interface (swipe from right or tap the icon in the upper right corner of the user interface).

attributes.description: Returns the checksum of the translation you have set with xcommand Translation Override Set. The checksum is blank if there is no override.
The error string reported from Chromium, usually a string representation of an internal enum value, e.g. "net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED" and "net::ERR_CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID".
Reports the type of error, if an error occurs while loading the web page.

description.CertificateError: The SSL certificate did not validate.
description.ConnectionError: Could not connect to the web server.
description.OutOfMemory: The web page used too much memory.

attributes.description: This is the status code reported from the webserver, e.g. 200 when the web page is loaded correctly, 404 when document not found etc.
Shows whether a web view is being displayed currently or not.

description.Error: There is an error displaying a web view.
description.Visible: A web view is being displayed.

attributes.description: Shows the type of web view currently being displayed.

description.ECM: The web view is launched from the file browser to view a file hosted on an Enterprise Content Management (ECM) service.
description.ECMSignIn: The web view is launched by the system to authenticate the user (OAuth2) with an ECM service.
description.Integration: The web view is launched by the UserInterface WebView Display API command.
description.Kiosk: The web view is used for the kiosk application.
description.PersistentWebApp: The web view is used for a persistent web app.
description.Signage: The web view is used for the digital signage application.
description.WebApp: The web view is used for a web app.
description.WebRTCMeeting: The web view is used for a WebRTC Meeting (for example, Google Meet and Microsoft Teams).
description.WebWidget: The web view is used for a web widget.
description.Whiteboard: The web view is used for a whiteboard.

attributes.description: Shows the URL of the web view that is currently being displayed.
Shows the position of the active speaker's image on the screen.
Indicates the operational status of the HDMI output on the device, showing whether it is currently enabled or disabled.

description.Disabled: The HDMI output is inactive.
description.Enabled: The HDMI output is active, which means that an extra screen can be connected.

attributes.description: Reports the AirPlay activity, that is, what kind of AirPlay content is shown/played back on the video device. This status isn't on the first generation of Board (non S-series) because these devices don't support AirPlay.

description.Audio: The device is playing back audio.
description.Curtain: The device is showing the AirPlay home page.
description.Idle: AirPlay is currently not in use.
description.PinInPip: The AirPlay code is shown in a small PiP (picture-in-picture).
description.Screen: An Apple device is sharing its screen on the video device (screen mirroring).
description.Settings: The device is showing one of the pages you can navigate to from the AirPlay home page (the Curtain sub menus).
description.Video: The device is playing back video.

attributes.description: Reports the status of the AirPlay service. This status isn't on the first generation of Board (non S-series) because these devices don't support AirPlay.

description.Active: AirPlay is in use (Video Input AirPlay Mode is On, and AirPlay is not switched off in the AirPlay menu on the UI).
description.Disabled: AirPlay is disabled from the AirPlay menu on the UI.
description.Error: There is an error starting AirPlay.
description.Off: AirPlay is turned off (Video Input AirPlay Mode is Off).
description.Stopped: AirPlay has currently stopped. It's not disabled or turned off; just not being used.

attributes.description: Shows whether is something is connected to the specified connector. Not all connections can be detected.
Shows what type of input device is connected.

objects.path: Video Input Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] DeviceType

attributes.description: Shows the CEC logical address of the connected input device. The address is fixed at 0.

objects.path: Video Input Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] LogicalAddress

attributes.description: Shows the name of the connected input device.

objects.path: Video Input Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] Name

attributes.description: Shows the state of the CEC enabled devise connected to the HDMI input.

objects.path: Video Input Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] PowerStatus

attributes.description: Shows the vendor ID for the connected input device.

objects.path: Video Input Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] VendorId

attributes.description: Shows if the device has detected an input signal on the specified input.

description.DetectingFormat: The device has detected an input signal, and is in the process of detecting its format.
description.NotFound: The device doesn't detect any input signal. Typically, this is the case when no cable is connected, or the connected source doesn't output video.
description.OK: The device detects a valid video input signal and the signal format support is reported in the Video Input Source [n] FormatStatus status.
description.Unstable: The device detects an unstable signal. Typically, this can be the case for a few seconds after you have connected the cable, that is, while the hardware tries to detect the video format. This value will also be returned when the device is not able to determine the signal format, or the signal format is inconsistent.

attributes.description: Shows the identifer of the input source that the connector is associated with.
Shows which connector type it is.
Shows the IP address of the connected direct share peer.
Shows a unique identifier of the direct share peer in question.
Shows the type of direct share peer.
Indicates whether sending of main video has been stopped by using the Video Input MainVideo Mute command (or, if available, the "Turn video off" button on the user interface).

description.Off: Video has not been stopped.
description.On: Video has been stopped.

attributes.description: Returns the local video input currently used as the main source. The value Composed is returned if the main source is composed of more than one local input. The default main video source is set with the xConfiguration Video DefaultMainSource command. It can be changed using xCommand Video Input SetMainVideoSource.

Reports which Wi-Fi channel Miracast is using for the direct connection between a sending device (typically, a meeting participant's laptop) and the video device. The status returns "-1" when Miracast is not enabled. See the Video Input Miracast Mode setting for more information.

When starting a Miracast share, users must enter a PIN code on their laptop. This status shows how many attempts they have left before PIN authentication for Miracast will be blocked for a given period. The counter is reset when a valid PIN code is entered. The more consecutive failed attempts, the longer the blocking period will be. When blocked, you can reactivate PIN authentication from a pop-up on the device screen or from the Settings menu.

Reports whether a direct Wi-Fi connection for Miracast is, or can be, established between a sending device (typically a meeting participant's laptop) and the video device. See the Video Input Miracast Mode setting for more information.

description.Started: Miracast is enabled, and a direct Wi-Fi connection between the two devices is, or can be, established. The device emits a Miracast beacon.
description.Stopped: Miracast is disabled, and a direct Wi-Fi connection between the two devices is therefore not possible. The device doesn't emit a Miracast beacon

attributes.description: Returns the current Miracast sharing transport method.

description.Direct: Content is being shared using Wi-Fi Direct.
description.Infrastructure: Content is being shared using the company's network infrastructure (using the MS-MICE protocol).
description.None: Content is currently not being shared.

attributes.description: Indicates the current availability status of the specified video input source [n]. This status helps determine whether the input source is actively in use or idle.

description.Busy: The video input source is actively in use.
description.Idle: The video input source is not in use.

attributes.description: Shows the identifier of the connector that is associated with the input source.
Shows the video format status and support for a specified video input signal. Only Ok marks a valid and supported video input format; all other states indicates an error.

description.Error: There is an error with the video input format. This can be the case when the video input signal is unstable (SignalState: Unstable) or the video input signal format cannot be determined (and none of the other error states can be used).
description.Interlaced: The video input format is interlaced, which isn't supported. The device support only progressive formats. Not all video input connectors can report this type of error.
description.NotFound: There is no video format present on the specified input. See the Video Input Connector [n] SignalState status for information why it might be missing.
description.Ok: The video input format is supported. The resolution and framerate is reported in Video Input Source [n] Resolution status.
description.OutOfRange: The video input format has higher resolution and/or framerate than the device supports for the specified input. Not all video input connectors can report this type of error.

attributes.description: Only for Cisco internal use.
Shows the resolution height (in pixels) for the video input source.
Shows the resolution refresh rate (Hz) for the video input source.
Shows the resolution width (in pixels) for the video input source.
This status shows if the active speaker is on stage.
Returns the name of the layout family that is currently used on the local screen.

Lists the names of all the layout families that are currently available for the local screen. The status will be updated dynamically when the number of participants and the presence of shared content change. If a layout family is included in the list, it's possible to change to it using the Video Layout SetLayout command.

Returns the layout family that will be used on the local screen as default in non-transcoded meetings. The default layout family is set with the Video DefaultLayoutFamily Local configuration. If this configuration is set to Auto, the status will show the actual layout family that it resolves to. This is determined by the number of screens with different layouts in your room setup, and whether a screen is reserved for presentations (refer to the Video Monitors setting).
Shows the local screen layout family.
Shows the remote screen layout family.
When the synchronized stage is active, this status will be true. It indicates that the stage view cannot be updated locally and will align with the host's stage.
This status notifies the local user that they are part of the stage.
Represents the active speaker index in the stage layout.
This status identifies that the stage is being controlled by the host.
Identifies the call ID associated with a specific participant [n] that has been added to the stage.
Displays the participant ID associated with a specific participant [n] that has been added to the stage.
Returns the monitor layout mode.

description.Dual: The layout is distributed on two monitors.
description.DualPresentationOnly: All participants in the call will be shown on the first monitor, while the presentation (if any) will be shown on the second monitor.
description.Single: The same layout is shown on all monitors.
description.Triple: The layout is distributed on three monitors.
description.TriplePresentationOnly: All participants in the call will be shown on the first and second monitors, while the presentation (if any) will be shown on the third monitor.

attributes.description: Describes whether a device (for example a display) is connected to the output connector or not. When a display enters standby mode, the video device may not be able to detect it. The connector status will then return False/Unknown even if the display is physically connected.

description.False: Nothing is connected to the video output connector.
description.True: A device is connected to the video output connector.

attributes.description: Shows the type of CEC enabled device connected to the HDMI output that the video device has detected. This information is only available when the device connected to the HDMI output has the CEC feature configured on and the video device has the configuration xConfiguration Video Output Connector [n] CEC Mode set to on.

objects.path: Video Output Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] DeviceType

attributes.description: Returns the name of the connected device.

objects.path: Video Output Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] Name

attributes.description: Shows the state of the CEC enabled devise connected to the HDMI output. This information is only available when the device connected to the HDMI output has the CEC feature configured on and the video device has the configuration xConfiguration Video Output Connector CEC Mode set to on.

objects.path: Video Output Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] PowerStatus

attributes.description: Returns the vendor ID for the connected device.

objects.path: Video Output Connector[n] ConnectedDevice CEC[n] VendorId

attributes.description: Shows the name of the monitor connected to the HDMI port as defined in the monitors EDID.
Shows the preferred input format of the monitor connected to the HDMI port as defined in the monitors EDID. This is not necessarily the format the video device is sending out.
Shows the screen size of the connected device in inches. If this information is not available, the default value is set to 0.
Reports whether both the connected screen (read from its EDID metadata) and the video device supports video with 1920 x 1080 resolution at 50 frames per second on this connector.

description.False: The format is not supported.
description.True: The format is supported.

objects.path: Video Output Connector[n] ConnectedDevice SupportedFormat Res_1920_1080_50

attributes.description: The status reports if the output supports HDCP, and if so, the state of the HDCP link toward a connected screen.

description.Authenticated: An HDCP link is established, and the link is stable. The connector can transmit HDCP protected content.
description.Inactive: The connector may support HDCP but is currently configured not to allow HDCP protected content (refer to the Video Output Connector [n] HDCPPolicy setting).
description.Unauthenticated: The connector is set up to allow HDCP protected content, but either there is no screen connected to it, or the device is in the process of establishing a link toward the screen. If the link is unstable, the device may remain in this state or revert to Inactive.
description.Unsupported: The connector doesn't support HDCP, and it can't be set up to support it.

attributes.description: Indicates the current version in use on the specified video output connector [n].

description.HDCP_v1x: The video output connector is using HDCP version 1.x.
description.HDCP_v2x: The video output connector is using HDCP version 2.x.
description.None: HDCP is not enabled on the video output connector.

attributes.description: Describes which video stream is shown on the device that is connected to the video output connector.

description.PresentationOnly: Shows presentation video stream if active.
description.Recorder: Shows all participants, including the local main video. If active, shows also the presentation.

attributes.description: Shows the resolution height (in pixels) for the video output connector.
Shows the resolution refresh rate (Hz) for the video output connector.
Shows the resolution width (in pixels) for the video output connector.
Shows the type of connector.

Reports whether the device is set up for streaming audio and video from its microphones and camera on the HDMI output that the HDMI-to-USB converter is connected to (refer to the Video Output HDMI Passthrough OutputConnector setting). The status changes with the Video Output HDMI Passthrough Start/Stop commands. This status is related to the Call from laptop feature. See the Video Output HDMI Passthrough Allowed configuration for more information. This status doesn't apply to Room 55 Dual and Room 70 Dual.

description.Active: The device is set up for streaming audio or video on the relevant HDMI output.
description.Inactive: The device is not set up for streaming audio or video on the relevant HDMI output.

attributes.description: Returns the backlight level of an integrated screen. The level has been set with xCommand Video Output Monitor Backlight Set.
Shows the calibration status of the display.

description.False: The display is not calibrated.
description.True: The display is calibrated.

attributes.description: Returns the monitors color temperature, that has been set with xCommand Video Output Monitor Color Select.
Shows the configuration status of the display.

description.False: The display is not configured.
description.True: The display is configured.

attributes.description: Shows the firmware version of the monitor. This status field is only populated when connecting with a supported LG monitor.
Shows the IP Address of the display.
Shows the manufacturer of the screen.
Shows the three-character manufacturer PnP (plug-and-play) id code for the connected screen.
Shows the MDC Id of the display.
Shows the MDC Port of the display.
Shows the model name of the monitor. This status field is only populated when connecting with a supported LG monitor.
Shows whether the monitor is positioned on the left or the right. Applicable for dual screen devices only.

Returns the serial number of the monitor, as reported by CDDC (Client Device Data Collector). If that's not available, information from EDID (Extended Display Identification Data) is reported if present. And if neither are available, an empty string is returned.
Shows the temperature of the monitor. This status field is only populated when connecting with a supported LG monitor.

description.High: The temperature of the monitor is too high.
description.Normal: The temperature of the monitor is normal.

attributes.description: In order to use the system as a webcam, one must establish a USB connection. This status shows the current state of the USB connection and whether audio or video is being streamed across it. "Video streaming" means that the frames that are captured by the camera of the device are continuously being transmitted across the USB connection as a video stream.

description.Connected: A USB connection is established, but no content is being streamed.
description.Disconnected: There is no USB connection established.
description.StreamingAudioOnly: Video is not being streamed, but audio is being streamed.

attributes.description: This status indicates whether or not the device currently is operating as a webcam. When operating as a webcam, the device is set into do-not-disturb mode. On Room Kit Mini, the Video Output Webcam USBMode setting can be used to control whether to enter USB mode (and therby also do-not-disturb mode) when you connect video or when you start streaming video. On other devices, it will enter this state only when video is being streamed across the USB connection.
Shows the position of the presentation image on the screen.
Shows whether self-view is set on full screen mode or not.
Shows whether self-view mode is set on or not.
Identifies which monitor(s) contains the self-view, if present.
Shows the position of the self-view image on the screen.
Reports whether or not the digital signage feature is enabled. It is enabled (On) only when both the WebEngine Mode and Standby Signage Mode settings are On.
Reports whether or not the web engine is enabled. It is enabled (On) when the WebEngine Mode setting is On.

Shows if WebRTC is enabled on the device. Through WebRTC, Webex devices and participants with devices in Personal mode, when invited to a WebRTC meeting (for example, Microsoft Teams and Google Meet), can join the meeting directly from their devices with One Button to Push (OBTP).
Returns the log level that is set for the web engine. Refer to the WebEngine Logging Set command for more information.
Returns the refined Verbose log level that is set for the web engine. Refer to the WebEngine Logging Set command for more information.
Returns the initial duration of the trace, in seconds (see the Duration parameter of the WebEngine Tracing Start command). Will be set to -1 when the trace ends.
Returns the mode used for the current trace (see the Mode parameter of the WebEngine Tracing Start command). Will be set to the empty string when the trace ends.
Returns whether or not the Android Systrace format is used (see the Systrace parameter of the WebEngine Tracing Start command).
Whether the device is configured for air-gapped operation.

This an id can be used to send cloud xAPI calls to devices through developer.webex.com. The cloud xAPI allows you to send commands and status requests to devices that are registered to the Webex cloud service or to an on-premises service and linked to Webex Edge for Devices. Most xAPI requests require a deviceId which can be obtained using this status.
This status applies to devices that are set up with hot desking. It reports whether the device has been booked or not.

description.Available: The device is available for booking.

attributes.description: When a user signs in using a QR code or other methods, their personal account takes over the shared device, temporarily personalizing it for their use.

description.False: Indicates that the device remains shared and is not personalized for any specific user.
description.True: Indicates that the device is personalized for the user who has signed in.

attributes.description: The base domain the device will use to connect to Webex. For confirming the domain configured in â€œxCommand Webex Registration AirGap Prepareâ€.

Reports whether it's possible to start an instant Webex meeting on the device. Instant Webex meetings are only available on shared devices, and the device must be registered to the Webex cloud service or linked to Webex Edge for devices with the Webex optimized experience enabled.

description.Available: It's possible to start an instant Webex meeting from the device.
description.Unavailable: It's not possible to start an instant Webex meeting from the device.

attributes.description: Shows if the device can join Webex Meetings using the Webex cloud service for calling.

description.SIP: The device will always use the on-premises infrastructure for calling. The call protocol is SIP.
description.Webex: The device will use the Webex cloud service for calling if all requirements are met (refer to the Webex Meetings JoinProtocol setting). Otherwise, the call protocol is SIP.

attributes.description: Whether the provisional activation service for anonymous log reporting and metrics is running and what state it is in.
Provides the device-specific code that can be used with devices.webex.com. Note that the code will change periodically. The status is only available for cloud-registered devices.

Shows the current custom status set for this user. Refer to the UserPresence CustomStatus Set commands. This status applies only to personal devices that are registered to the Webex cloud service or linked to Webex Edge for devices. User presence is tied to the user (that is, the person that the device is registered to), hence the same status will show on the device and on Webex apps belonging to this person.

Shows the current availability status of the user (for example, if the user is active, in a meeting, sharing a presentation, etc.). This status applies only to personal devices that are registered to the Webex cloud service or linked to Webex Edge for devices. User presence is tied to the user (that is, the person that the device is registered to), hence the same status will show on the device and on Webex apps belonging to this person.

Reports the status of the connection between the device and the Webex cloud service. If the cloud service is up and running, the status reports Registered. If the device is registered to an on-premise service such as CUCM or VCS, the status reports Disabled.
Shows if the device can join a GoogleMeet meeting, either from the GoogleMeet button or from the meeting invitation.
Shows if the device can join a Microsoft Teams meeting, either from the MSTeams button or from the meeting invitation.
